author: wsjcom
title: Guatemalan Case Against the Bitkovs Is Just
text:
Mary Anastasia O’Grady’s “Kremlin Revenge in Guatemala” (Americas, March 26) unfortunately perpetuates an inaccurate portrayal of Russia’s banking industry and its state banks. In alleging the influence of “Kremlin’s long arm” in all the wide scope of banks’ operations, it also presents a one-sided account of the Igor and Irena Bitkov developments.
It is true that around 70% of the Russian banking sector is represented by the banks with significant state equity participation. Nevertheless, such major financial institutions...
